page.title: 02RUNCORN'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: At Norton Priory you can see the many finds which the site has yielded.One of the many exhibits which interest the hundreds of school parties which visit the museum annually,is a coffin of a Canon,who lived at the priory hundreds of years ago.(Canons lived at the Priory from 1134-1536) Looking at the many exhibits,one gets a good impression of what life was like in an ancient priory.Since the site has been excavated,one can walk in the undercroft and look at the magnificent statue of St.Christopher. On Bank holidays at Norton Priory, Family Fun Days are held.I wonder what the Canons would think if they returned!There's an excellent education department at the museum which helps visiting children.
